doc.name: TinyMCE
doc.footer: JavaScript API documentation was generated with moxiedoc

method.name: clearArray
method.summary: Returns a cleared array, since some external libraries tend to extend the Array core object arrays needs to be cleaned from these extended functions. So this function simply setting any named properties to null.

return.summary: Cleared name/value array.

method.name: explode
method.summary: Splits a string by the specified delimiter and skips any empty items.

param.name: d
param.summary: Delimiter to split by.

param.name: s
param.summary: String to split.

return.summary: Array with chunks from string.

method.name: cleanupHTMLCode
method.summary: Makes some preprocessing cleanup routines on the specified HTML string. This includes forcing some tags to be open so MSIE doesn't fail. Forcing other to close and padding paragraphs with non breaking spaces. This function is used when the editor gets initialized with content.

param.name: s
param.summary: HTML string to cleanup.

return.summary: Cleaned HTML string.

method.name: parseStyle
method.summary: Parses the specified HTML style data. This will parse for example "border-left: 1px; background-color: red" into an key/value array.

param.name: str
param.summary: Style data to parse.

return.summary: Name/Value array of style items.

method.name: compressStyle
method.summary: Compresses larger styles into a smaller. Since MSIE automaticly converts border: 1px solid red to border-left: 1px solid red, border-righ: 1px solid red and so forth.' This will bundle them together again if the information is the same in each item.

param.name: ar
param.summary: Style name/value array with items.

param.name: pr
param.summary: Style item prefix to bundle for example border.

param.name: sf
param.summary: Style item suffix to bunlde for example -width or -width.

param.name: res
param.summary: Result name, for example border-width.

method.name: serializeStyle
method.summary: Serializes the specified style item name/value array into a HTML string. This function will force HEX colors in Firefox and convert the URL items of a style correctly.

param.name: ar
param.summary: Name/Value array of items to serialize.

return.summary: Serialized HTML string containing the items.

method.name: convertRGBToHex
method.summary: Returns a hexadecimal version of the specified rgb(1,2,3) string.

param.name: s
param.summary: RGB string to parse, if this doesn't isn't a rgb(n,n,n) it will passthrough the string.

param.name: k
param.summary: Keep before/after contents. If enabled contents before after the rgb(n,n,n) will be intact.

return.summary: Hexadecimal version of the specified rgb(1,2,3) string.

method.name: convertHexToRGB
method.summary: Returns a rgb(n,n,n) string from a hexadecimal value.

param.name: s
param.summary: Hexadecimal string to parse.

return.summary: rgb(n,n,n) string from a hexadecimal value.

method.name: convertSpansToFonts
method.summary: Converts span elements to font elements in the specified document instance. Todo: Move this function into a XHTML plugin or simmilar.

param.name: doc
param.summary: Document instance to convert spans in.

method.name: convertFontsToSpans
method.summary: Convers fonts to spans in the specified document. Todo: Move this function into a XHTML plugin or simmilar.

param.name: doc
param.summary: Document instance to convert fonts in.

method.name: cleanupAnchors
method.summary: Moves the contents of a anchor outside and after the anchor. Only if the anchor doesn't have a href.

param.name: doc
param.summary: DOM document instance to fix anchors in.

method.name: getContent
method.summary: Returns the HTML contents of the specified editor instance id.

param.name: editor_id
param.summary: Editor instance id to retrive HTML code from.

return.summary: HTML contents of editor id or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: debug
method.summary: Debugs the specified message to devkit if it's loaded.

method.name: createTagHTML
method.summary: Creates a HTML tag by name and attributes array. This will XML encode all attribute values.

param.name: tn
param.summary: Tag name to create.

param.name: a
param.summary: Optional name/Value array of attributes.

param.name: h
param.summary: Optional inner HTML of new tag, raw HTML code.

method.name: createTag
method.summary: Creates a tag by name and attributes array. This will create a DOM node out of the specified data.

param.name: d
param.summary: Document to create DOM node in.

param.name: tn
param.summary: Tag name to create.

param.name: a
param.summary: Optional name/Value array of attributes.

param.name: h
param.summary: Optional inner HTML of new tag, raw HTML code.

method.name: getElementByAttributeValue
method.summary: Returns a element by a specific attribute and it's value.

param.name: n
param.summary: Element to search in.

param.name: e
param.summary: Element name to search for.

param.name: a
param.summary: Attribute name to search for.

param.name: v
param.summary: Attribute value to search for.

return.summary: HTML element that matched the criterias or null on failure.

method.name: getElementsByAttributeValue
method.summary: Returns a element array by a specific attribute and it's value.

param.name: n
param.summary: Element to search in.

param.name: e
param.summary: Element name to search for.

param.name: a
param.summary: Attribute name to search for.

param.name: v
param.summary: Attribute value to search for.

return.summary: HTML element array that matched the criterias or null on failure.

method.name: isBlockElement
method.summary: Returns true/false if the specified node is a block element or not.

param.name: n
param.summary: Node to verify.

return.summary: true/false if the specified node is a block element or not.

method.name: getParentBlockElement
method.summary: Returns the first block element parent of the specified node.

param.name: n
param.summary: Node get parent block element for.

param.name: r
param.summary: Optional root element, never go below this point.

return.summary: First block element parent of the specified node or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: insertAfter
method.summary: Inserts a node after the specific node.

param.name: n
param.summary: New node to insert.

param.name: r
param.summary: Reference node to insert after.

method.name: setInnerHTML
method.summary: Sets the innerHTML property of a element, this function also fixes a MSIE bug where the first comment is removed.

param.name: e
param.summary: Element to insert HTML in.

param.name: h
param.summary: HTML code to insert into innerHTML.

method.name: getOuterHTML
method.summary: Returns the outer HTML of a element, this uses the outerHTML property in MSIE and Opera and a workaround for Gecko.

param.name: e
param.summary: HTML element to get outerHTML from.

return.summary: HTML content string.

method.name: setOuterHTML
method.summary: Sets the outer HTML of a element, this uses the outerHTML property in MSIE and Opera and a workaround for Gecko.

param.name: e
param.summary: HTML element to set outerHTML on.

param.name: h
param.summary: HTML string to set in property.

param.name: d
param.summary: Optional document instance (Required in old IE versions).

method.name: _getElementById
method.summary: Returns a element by id, this will also search the form names to match the id.

param.name: id
param.summary: Id of element.

param.name: d
param.summary: Optional document.

return.summary: HTML element that matches the id.

method.name: getNodeTree
method.summary: Returns a array of nodes selected retrived from the child nodes of the specified node.

param.name: n
param.summary: Node to get children from.

param.name: na
param.summary: Array to fill with children.

param.name: t
param.summary: Node type to get.

param.name: nn
param.summary: Node name of items to retrive.

return.summary: Node array.

method.name: getParentElement
method.summary: Returns the parent element of the specified node based on the search criteria.

param.name: node
param.summary: Node to get parent element of.

param.name: na
param.summary: Comma separated list of element names to get.

param.name: f
param.summary: Optional function to call for each node, if it returns true the node is valid.

param.name: r
param.summary: Optional root element, never go below this point.

return.summary: HTMLElement or null based on search criteras.

method.name: getParentNode
method.summary: Returns a node by the specified selector function. This function will loop through all parent nodes and call the specified function for each node. If the function then returns true it will stop the execution and return that node.

param.name: n
param.summary: HTML node to search parents on.

param.name: f
param.summary: Selection function to execute on each node.

param.name: r
param.summary: Optional root element, never go below this point.

return.summary: DOMNode or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: getAttrib
method.summary: Returns the attribute value of a element or the default value if it wasn't found.

param.name: elm
param.summary: HTML element to get attribute from.

param.name: name
param.summary: Attribute name to retrive.

param.name: dv
param.summary: Optional default value to return, this value defaults to a empty string.

return.summary: Attribute value or default value if it wasn't found in element.

method.name: setAttrib
method.summary: Sets the attribute value for a specific attribute.

param.name: el
param.summary: HTML element to set attribute on.

param.name: name
param.summary: Attribute name to set.

param.name: va
param.summary: Attribute value to set.

param.name: fix
param.summary: Optional fix value state, if true only number data will be accepted.

method.name: setStyleAttrib
method.summary: Sets a style attribute item value.

param.name: e
param.summary: HTML element to set style attribute item on.

param.name: n
param.summary: Style item name to set.

param.name: v
param.summary: Style item value to set.

method.name: switchClass
method.summary: Switches the CSS class of the specified element. This method also caches the elements in a lookup table for performance. This should only be used for TinyMCE main UI controls like buttons or select elements.

param.name: ei
param.summary: Element to set CSS class on.

param.name: c
param.summary: CSS class to set.

method.name: getAbsPosition
method.summary: Returns the absolute x, y position of a node. The position will be returned in a object with two properties absLeft and absTop.

param.name: n
param.summary: HTML element to get x, y position from.

param.name: cn
param.summary: Optional HTML element to to stop position calcualtion by.

return.summary: Absolute position of the specified element.

method.name: prevNode
method.summary: Finds any previous element by name. This will loop through the siblings inorder to find the specified element by name. If the element wasn't found it will return a null value.

param.name: e
param.summary: HTML node to search from.

param.name: n
param.summary: Comma separated list of element names to search for.

return.summary: HTML Element or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: nextNode
method.summary: Finds any element after the current one by name. This will loop through the siblings inorder to find the specified element by name. If the element wasn't found it will return a null value.

param.name: e
param.summary: HTML node to search from.

param.name: n
param.summary: Comma separated list of element names to search for.

return.summary: HTML Element or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: selectElements
method.summary: Returns a array of elements when the specified function matches a node.

param.name: n
param.summary: Node to select children from.

param.name: na
param.summary: Element name(s) to search for separated by commas.

param.name: f
param.summary: Function that returns true/false if the node is to be added or not.

return.summary: Array with selected elements.

method.name: selectNodes
method.summary: Returns a array of nodes when the specified function matches a node.

param.name: n
param.summary: Node to select children from.

param.name: f
param.summary: Function that returns true/false if the node is to be added or not.

param.name: a
param.summary: Optional array to fill with nodes.

return.summary: Array with selected nodes.

method.name: addCSSClass
method.summary: Adds a CSS class to the specified element. It will remove any previous item with the same name so adding a class that already exists will move it to the end.

param.name: e
param.summary: HTML element to add CSS class to.

return.summary: Returns the new class attribute value.

method.name: removeCSSClass
method.summary: Removes the specified CSS class from the element.

param.name: e
param.summary: HTML element to remove CSS class to.

return.summary: Returns the new class attribute value.

method.name: hasCSSClass
method.summary: Returns true if the specified element has the specified class.

param.name: n
param.summary: HTML element to check CSS class on.

return.summary: true/false if the specified element has the specified class.

method.name: renameElement
method.summary: Renames the specified element to the specified name.

param.name: e
param.summary: Element to rename.

param.name: n
param.summary: New name of the element.

param.name: d
param.summary: Optional document reference.

method.name: getViewPort
method.summary: Returns the viewport of the specificed window instance.

param.name: w
param.summary: Window to get viewport of.

return.summary: Viewport object with fields top, left, width and height.

method.name: getStyle
method.summary: Returns the current runtime/computed style value of a element.

param.name: n
param.summary: HTML element to get style from.

param.name: na
param.summary: Style name to return.

param.name: d
param.summary: Optional default value.

return.summary: Current runtime/computed style value of a element.

constructor.name: TinyMCE_Engine
constructor.summary: Core engine class for TinyMCE, a instance of this class is available as a global called tinyMCE.

method.name: init
method.summary: Initializes TinyMCE with the specific configuration settings. This method may be called multiple times when multiple instances with diffrent settings is to be created.

method.name: hasPlugin
method.summary: Returns true/false if the specified plugin is loaded or not.

param.name: n
param.summary: Plugin name to look for.

return.summary: true/false if the specified plugin is loaded or not.

method.name: addPlugin
method.summary: Adds the specified plugin to the list of loaded plugins, this will also setup the baseURL property of the plugin.

param.name: p
param.summary: Plugin instance to add.

method.name: setPluginBaseURL
method.summary: Sets the baseURL of the specified plugin, this is useful if the plugin is loaded from a external location.

param.name: n
param.summary: Plugin name/id to set base URL on. This have to be added before.

param.name: u
param.summary: Base URL of plugin, this string should be the URL prefix for the plugin without a trailing slash.

method.name: loadPlugin
method.summary: Load plugin from external URL.

param.name: n
param.summary: Plugin name for example \"emotions\".

param.name: u
param.summary: URL of plugin directory to load.

method.name: hasTheme
method.summary: Returns true/false if the specified theme is loaded or not.

param.name: n
param.summary: Theme name/id to check for.

return.summary: true/false if the specified theme is loaded or not.

method.name: addTheme
method.summary: Adds the specified theme in to the list of loaded themes.

param.name: n
param.summary: Theme name/id to add the object reference to.

param.name: t
param.summary: Theme instance to add to the loaded list.

method.name: addMenu
method.summary: Adds a floating menu instance to TinyMCE.

param.name: n
param.summary: TinyMCE menu id.

param.name: m
param.summary: TinyMCE menu instance.

method.name: hasMenu
method.summary: Checks if the specified menu by name is added to TinyMCE.

param.name: n
param.summary: TinyMCE menu id.

return.summary: true/false if it exists or not.

method.name: loadScript
method.summary: Loads the specified script by writing the a script tag to the current page. This will also check if the file has been loaded before. This function should only be used when the page is loading.

param.name: url
param.summary: Script URL to load.

method.name: loadNextScript
method.summary: Loads the next script in chain.

method.name: loadCSS
method.summary: Loads the specified CSS by writing the a link tag to the current page. This will also check if the file has been loaded before. This function should only be used when the page is loading.

param.name: url
param.summary: CSS file URL to load or comma separated list of files.

method.name: importCSS
method.summary: Imports a CSS file into a allready loaded document. This will add a link element to the head element of the document.

param.name: doc
param.summary: DOM Document to load CSS into.

param.name: css
param.summary: CSS File URL to load or comma separated list of files.

method.name: confirmAdd
method.summary: Displays a confirm dialog when a user clicks/focus a textarea that is to be converted into a TinyMCE instance.

param.name: e
param.summary: DOM event instance.

param.name: settings
param.summary: Name/Value array of initialization settings.

method.name: updateContent
method.summary: Moves the contents from the hidden textarea to the editor that gets inserted.

param.name: form_element_name
param.summary: Form element name to move contents from.

method.name: addMCEControl
method.summary: Adds a TinyMCE editor control instance to a specific form element.

param.name: replace_element
param.summary: HTML element object to replace.

param.name: form_element_name
param.summary: HTML form element name,

param.name: target_document
param.summary: Target document that holds the element.

method.name: removeInstance
method.summary: Removes the specified instance from TinyMCE Engine.

param.name: ti
param.summary: Target instance to remove from TinyMCE.

return.summary: Removed MCEControl instance.

method.name: removeMCEControl
method.summary: Removes a TinyMCE editor control instance by id.

param.name: editor_id
param.summary: Id of editor instance to remove.

method.name: triggerSave
method.summary: Moves the contents from a TinyMCE editor control instance to the hidden textarea that got replaced with TinyMCE. This is executed automaticly on for example form submit.

param.name: skip_cleanup
param.summary: Optional Skip cleanup, simply move the contents as fast as possible.

param.name: skip_callback
param.summary: Optional Skip callback, don't call the save_callback function.

method.name: resetForm
method.summary: Resets a forms TinyMCE instances based on form index.

param.name: form_index
param.summary: Form index to reset.

method.name: execInstanceCommand
method.summary: Executes a command on a specific editor instance by id.

param.name: editor_id
param.summary: TinyMCE editor control instance id to perform comman on.

param.name: command
param.summary: Command name to execute, for example mceLink or Bold.

param.name: user_interface
param.summary: True/false state if a UI (dialog) should be presented or not.

param.name: value
param.summary: Optional command value, this can be anything.

param.name: focus
param.summary: True/false if the editor instance should be focused first.

method.name: execCommand
method.summary: Executes a command on the selected or last selected TinyMCE editor control instance. This function also handles some non instance specific commands like mceAddControl, mceRemoveControl, mceHelp or mceFocus.

param.name: command
param.summary: Command name to execute, for example mceLink or Bold.

param.name: user_interface
param.summary: True/false state if a UI (dialog) should be presented or not.

param.name: value
param.summary: Optional command value, this can be anything.

method.name: setupContent
method.summary: Setups the contents of TinyMCE editor instance and fills it with contents.

param.name: editor_id
param.summary: TinyMCE editor instance control id to fill.

method.name: storeAwayURLs
method.summary: Stores away the src and href attribute values in separate mce_src and mce_href attributes. This is needed since both MSIE and Gecko messes with these attributes. The old src and href will be intact, this simply adds them to a separate attribute.

param.name: s
param.summary: HTML string to replace src and href attributes in.

return.summary: HTML string with replaced src and href attributes.

method.name: _removeInternal
method.summary: Removes any internal content inserted by regexps.

param.name: n
param.summary: Node to remove internal content from.

method.name: removeTinyMCEFormElements
method.summary: Removes/disables TinyMCE built in form elements such as select boxes for font sizes etc. These are disabled when the user submits a form so they don't get picked up by the backend script that intercepts the contents.

param.name: form_obj
param.summary: Form object to loop through for TinyMCE specific form elements.

method.name: handleEvent
method.summary: Event handler function that gets executed each time a event occurs in a TinyMCE editor control instance. Todo: Fix the return statements so they return true or false.

param.name: e
param.summary: DOM event object reference.

return.summary: true - if the event is to be chained, false - if the event chain is to be canceled.

method.name: getButtonHTML
method.summary: Returns the HTML code for a normal button control.

param.name: id
param.summary: Button control id, this will be the suffix for the element id, the prefix is the editor id.

param.name: lang
param.summary: Language variable key name to insert as the title/alt of the button image.

param.name: img
param.summary: Image URL to insert, {$themeurl} and {$pluginurl} will be replaced.

param.name: cmd
param.summary: Command to execute when the user clicks the button.

param.name: ui
param.summary: Optional user interface boolean for command.

param.name: val
param.summary: Optional value for command.

return.summary: HTML code for a normal button based in input information.

method.name: getMenuButtonHTML
method.summary: Returns the HTML code for a normal button control.

param.name: id
param.summary: Button control id, this will be the suffix for the element id, the prefix is the editor id.

param.name: lang
param.summary: Language variable key name to insert as the title/alt of the button image.

param.name: img
param.summary: Image URL to insert, {$themeurl} and {$pluginurl} will be replaced.

param.name: mcmd
param.summary: Command to execute when the user clicks the menu arrow button.

param.name: cmd
param.summary: Command to execute when the user clicks the main button.

param.name: ui
param.summary: Optional user interface boolean for command.

param.name: val
param.summary: Optional value for command.

return.summary: HTML code for a normal button based in input information.

method.name: _menuButtonEvent
method.summary: Switched classes on menu elements in MSIE.

param.name: e
param.summary: Event name out, over.

param.name: o
param.summary: HTML element to set class on.

method.name: addButtonMap
method.summary: Adds a list of buttons available in the tiled button image used by the button_tile_map option.

param.name: m
param.summary: Comma separated list of buttons that are available in tiled image.

method.name: formSubmit
method.summary: Gets called when a form is submited with a f.submit call or when a submit button is pressed.

param.name: f
param.summary: Form element that got submitted.

param.name: p
param.summary: Is it a f.submit pathed call.

method.name: submitPatch
method.summary: Piggyback onsubmit event handler function, this will remove/hide the TinyMCE specific form elements call triggerSave to fill the textarea with the correct contents then call the old piggy backed event handler.

method.name: onLoad
method.summary: Gets executed when the page loads or get intitialized. This function will then convert all textareas/divs that is to be converted into TinyMCE editor controls.

return.summary: true - if the event is to be chained, false - if the event chain is to be canceled.

method.name: isInstance
method.summary: Returns true/false if a specific object is a TinyMCE_Control instance or not.

param.name: o
param.summary: Object to check.

return.summary: true/false if it's a control or not.

method.name: getParam
method.summary: Returns a specific configuration setting or the default value if it wasn't found.

param.name: name
param.summary: Configuration setting to get.

param.name: default_value
param.summary: Default value to return if it wasn't found.

param.name: strip_whitespace
param.summary: Optional remove all whitespace.

param.name: split_chr
param.summary: Split char/regex/string.

return.summary: Number, string or other object based in parameter and default_value.

method.name: getLang
method.summary: Returns a language variable value from the language packs.

param.name: name
param.summary: Name of the key to retrive.

param.name: default_value
param.summary: Optional default value to return if it wasn't found.

param.name: parse_entities
param.summary: Is HTML entities to be resolved or not.

param.name: va
param.summary: Optional name/value array of variables to replace in language string.

return.summary: Language string value could be a number if it's a relative dimenstion.

method.name: entityDecode
method.summary: HTML entity decode a string, replaces < with <.

param.name: s
param.summary: Entity string to decode into normal string.

return.summary: Entity decoded string.

method.name: addToLang
method.summary: Adds language items to the global language array.

param.name: prefix
param.summary: Prefix string to add infront of every array item before adding it.

param.name: ar
param.summary: Language item array to add to global language array.

method.name: triggerNodeChange
method.summary: Triggers a nodeChange event to every theme and plugin. This will be executed when the cursor moves or when a command that modifies the editor contents is executed.

param.name: focus
param.summary: Optional state if the last selected editor instance is to be focused or not.

param.name: setup_content
param.summary: Optional state if it's called from setup content function or not.

method.name: setContent
method.summary: Sets the HTML contents of the selected editor instance.

param.name: h
param.summary: HTML contents to set in the selected instance.

method.name: importThemeLanguagePack
method.summary: Loads a theme specific language pack.

param.name: name
param.summary: Optional name of the theme to load language pack from.

method.name: importPluginLanguagePack
method.summary: Loads a plugin specific language pack.

param.name: name
param.summary: Plugin name/id to load language pack for.

method.name: applyTemplate
method.summary: Replaces language, args and settings variables in a HTML string.

param.name: h
param.summary: HTML string to replace language variables in.

param.name: ag
param.summary: Optional arguments array to take variables from.

return.summary: HTML string with replaced varliables.

method.name: replaceVar
method.summary: Replaces a specific variable in the string with a nother string.

param.name: h
param.summary: String to search in for the variable.

param.name: r
param.summary: Variable name to search for.

param.name: v
param.summary: Value to insert where a variable is found.

return.summary: String with replaced variable.

method.name: openWindow
method.summary: Opens a popup window based in the specified input data. This function is used for all popup windows in TinyMCE. These are the current template keys: file, width, height, close_previous.

param.name: template
param.summary: Popup template data such as with, height etc.

param.name: args
param.summary: Popup arguments that is to be passed to the popup such as custom data.

method.name: closeWindow
method.summary: Closes the specified window. This function is deprecated and should be replaced with tinyMCEPopup.close();.

param.name: win
param.summary: Window reference to close.

method.name: getVisualAidClass
method.summary: Returns the visual aid class string, this will add/remove the visual aid class.

param.name: class_name
param.summary: Class name value to add/remove visual aid classes from.

param.name: state
param.summary: true/false if the classes should be added or removed.

return.summary: New class value containing the visual aid classes or not.

method.name: handleVisualAid
method.summary: Adds visual aid classes to all elements that need them recursive in the DOM tree.

param.name: el
param.summary: HTML element to add visual aid classes to.

param.name: deep
param.summary: Should they be added to all children aswell.

param.name: state
param.summary: Should they be added or removed.

param.name: inst
param.summary: TinyMCE editor control instance to add/remove them to/from.

method.name: fixGeckoBaseHREFBug
method.summary: Fixes a Gecko specific bug where href, src attribute values gets converted incorrectly when inserted into editor. This function will replace all src, href with mce_tsrc and mce_thref to keep the values from chaging when they get inserted.

param.name: m
param.summary: Mode state, true is to replace the src, href attributes to mce_tsrc and mce_thref.

param.name: e
param.summary: HTML element to replace them in. (Will be used if m is 0)

param.name: h
param.summary: HTML code to replace them in. (Will be used if m is 1)

return.summary: Converted string or the specified HTML value depending on mode.

method.name: getEditorId
method.summary: Returns the editor instance id of a specific form element.

param.name: form_element
param.summary: Form element name to get instance id for.

return.summary: TinyMCE editor instance id or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: getInstanceById
method.summary: Returns a TinyMCE editor instance by the specified editor id or null if it wasn't found.

param.name: editor_id
param.summary: Editor id to get instance for.

return.summary: TinyMCE editor control instance or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: queryInstanceCommandValue
method.summary: Queries a command value for a specific command on a specific editor instance.

param.name: editor_id
param.summary: Editor id to query command value on.

param.name: command
param.summary: Command to query for.

return.summary: Command value passed from browser.

method.name: queryInstanceCommandState
method.summary: Queries a command state for a specific command on a specific editor instance.

param.name: editor_id
param.summary: Editor id to query command state on.

param.name: command
param.summary: Command to query for.

return.summary: Command state passed from browser.

method.name: setWindowArg
method.summary: Sets the window argument to be passed to TinyMCE popup.

param.name: n
param.summary: Window argument name.

param.name: v
param.summary: Window argument value.

method.name: getWindowArg
method.summary: Returns the window argument to be passed to TinyMCE popup. Use: tinyMCEPopup.getWindowArg instead.

param.name: n
param.summary: Window argument name.

return.summary: Argument value or default value if it wasn't found.

method.name: getCSSClasses
method.summary: Returns a array of CSS classes that is available in a document. Todo: Fix this one, it's so ugly. :)

param.name: editor_id
param.summary: Editor id to get CSS classes from.

param.name: doc
param.summary: DOM document to get the CSS classes from.

return.summary: Array of CSS classes that is available in a document.

method.name: regexpReplace
method.summary: Regexp replaces the contents of a string. Use normal replace instead.

param.name: in_str
param.summary: String to replace in.

param.name: reg_exp
param.summary: Regexp to replace.

param.name: replace_str
param.summary: String to replace with.

param.name: in_str
param.summary: Optional regexp options like "gi".

return.summary: Replaced string value.

method.name: trim
method.summary: Removes all prefix, suffix whitespace of a string.

param.name: s
param.summary: String to replace whitespace in.

return.summary: Replaced string value.

method.name: cleanupEventStr
method.summary: Removes MSIE 5.5 specific event wrapper function form a event string. This will also remove the event blocker if it's added in front of the event.

param.name: s
param.summary: String to replace event data in.

return.summary: Replaced string value.

method.name: getControlHTML
method.summary: Returns the HTML for the specified control this will loop through the theme and all plugins inorder to find the control. The callback for each theme and plugin is called getControlHTML.

param.name: c
param.summary: Control name/id to get HTML code for.

return.summary: HTML code for the specified control or empty string if it wasn't found.

method.name: evalFunc
method.summary: Evaluates the specified function and uses the array of arguments.

param.name: f
param.summary: Function reference to execute.

param.name: idx
param.summary: Index in array to start grabbing arguments from.

param.name: a
param.summary: Array of function arguments.

param.name: o
param.summary: Optional object reference to call function on.

return.summary: Value returned from the evaluated function.

method.name: dispatchCallback
method.summary: Dispatches the specified callback on all options, plugins and themes. This will not chain them, so all functions callbacks will be executed regardless if the return true/false.

param.name: i
param.summary: TinyMCE editor control instance to execute callback on.

param.name: p
param.summary: TinyMCE callback parameter to execute.

param.name: n
param.summary: Function name to execute.

return.summary: true/false if they where dispatched.

method.name: executeCallback
method.summary: Executes the specified callback on all options, plugins and themes. This will chain them, so callback chain will be broken if one function returns false.

param.name: i
param.summary: TinyMCE editor control instance to execute callback on.

param.name: p
param.summary: TinyMCE callback parameter to execute.

param.name: n
param.summary: Function name to execute.

return.summary: true/false if a callback was executed.

method.name: execCommandCallback
method.summary: Executes the specified execcommand callback on all options, plugins and themes. This will chain them, so callback chain will be broken if one function returns true.

param.name: i
param.summary: TinyMCE editor control instance to execute callback on.

param.name: p
param.summary: TinyMCE callback parameter to execute.

param.name: n
param.summary: Function name to execute.

return.summary: true/false if a callback was executed.

method.name: callFunc
method.summary: Executes callback chain. Callback order: Option, Plugins, Themes.

param.name: ins
param.summary: TinyMCE editor control instance to execute callback on.

param.name: p
param.summary: TinyMCE callback parameter name.

param.name: n
param.summary: Function name to execute.

param.name: m
param.summary: Execution mode value, 0 = no chain, 1 = event chain, 2 = execcommand chain.

param.name: a
param.summary: Array with function arguments.

return.summary: true - if the callback was executed, false if it wasn't.

method.name: resolveDots
method.summary: Resolves a x.x.x string into a reference for objects in object in objects.

param.name: s
param.summary: Dot notation string.

param.name: o
param.summary: Object tree.

return.summary: Reference based on dots.

method.name: xmlEncode
method.summary: Encodes the string to raw XML entities. This will only convert the most common ones. For real entity encoding use the xmlEncode method of the Cleanup class.

param.name: s
param.summary: String to encode.

return.summary: XML Encoded string.

method.name: add
method.summary: Add methods to existing class.

param.name: c
param.summary: Function/Class to add methods to.

param.name: m
param.summary: List of methods to add. Name/Value collection.

method.name: extend
method.summary: Extends the specified prototype with new methods.

param.name: p
param.summary: Prototype to extend with new methods.

param.name: np
param.summary: New prototype to extend the other one with.

return.summary: Extended prototype array.

method.name: unloadHandler
method.summary: Unload document event handler function. This function will be executed when the page is unloaded, this will automaticly move the current editor contents to the textarea element this enables the editor to restore it's state when the user presses the back button in the browser. This will execute the triggerSave function.

method.name: addEventHandlers
method.summary: Adds the handleEvent function to the specified editor instance.

param.name: inst
param.summary: Editor control instance to add event handler to.

method.name: setEventHandlers
method.summary: Sets or removes event handles form the specified instance.

param.name: s
param.summary: True/false state if to add or remove event handlers.

method.name: onMouseMove
method.summary: Mouse move handler function, this will be executed each time the mouse is moved within a editor instance. This function stores away the current selection in MSIE this will then be used when a undo/redo level is added.

method.name: cancelEvent
method.summary: Cancels the specified event, this will disable the event from be passed to other listeners in event chain.

param.name: e
param.summary: Event to cancel.

return.summary: Returns false.

method.name: addEvent
method.summary: Adds a event handler function to the specified object.

param.name: o
param.summary: Object to add event handler to.

param.name: n
param.summary: Event name to listen to for example "click".

param.name: h
param.summary: Function handler to execute when event occurs.

method.name: removeEvent
method.summary: Removes a event handler function from the specified object.

param.name: o
param.summary: Object to remove event handler from.

param.name: n
param.summary: Event name to stop listening for. Example "click".

param.name: h
param.summary: Function handler to detach from the event.

method.name: addSelectAccessibility
method.summary: Adds accessibility keydown handler to the specified select element.

param.name: e
param.summary: Event that gets passed when the element is focused.

param.name: s
param.summary: Select element that the keydown handler gets added to.

param.name: w
param.summary: DOM window reference to add.

method.name: accessibleEventHandler
method.summary: Accessibility handler that gets executed when the user hits a key in a select element. This handler trams the enter/return or space key and then executes the onchange event handler.

param.name: e
param.summary: DOM event object instance.

method.name: _resetIframeHeight
method.summary: Resets the iframe width and height to it's old values before a drag/drop operation occured. This function is used in a workaround for a MSIE bug where drag/drop fails in iframes with width/height in %.

method.name: parseURL
method.summary: Parses a URL in to its diffrent components.

param.name: url_str
param.summary: URL string to parse into a URL object.

return.summary: URL object based on input string.

method.name: serializeURL
method.summary: Serializes the specified URL object into a string.

param.name: up
param.summary: URL object to serialize.

return.summary: Serialized URL object.

method.name: convertAbsoluteURLToRelativeURL
method.summary: Converts an absolute path to relative path.

param.name: base_url
param.summary: URL to make as a base path, URLs will be converted relative from this point.

param.name: url_to_relative
param.summary: URL to convert into a relative URL.

return.summary: Relative URL based in input.

method.name: convertRelativeToAbsoluteURL
method.summary: Converts an relative path to absolute path.

param.name: base_url
param.summary: URL to make as a base path, URLs will be converted absolute from this point.

param.name: relative_url
param.summary: URL to convert into a absolute URL.

return.summary: Absolute URL based in input.

method.name: convertURL
method.summary: Converts the specified URL based in TinyMCE configuration settings.

param.name: url
param.summary: URL to convert based on config.

param.name: node
param.summary: HTML element that holds the URL.

param.name: on_save
param.summary: Is this convertion the final output URL.

return.summary: Converted URL string.

method.name: convertAllRelativeURLs
method.summary: Converts all img and a element URLs to absolute URLs. This will use the mce_src or mce_href attribute values if they are provided. This function is used when the editor is initialized.

param.name: body
param.summary: HTML element to convert all URLs in.

method.name: init
method.summary: Initializes the cleanup engine with the specified config.

param.name: s
param.summary: Name/Value array with config settings.

method.name: addRuleStr
method.summary: Adds a cleanup rule string, for example: a[!href|!name|title=title|class=class1?class2?class3]. These rules are then used when serializing the DOM tree as a HTML string, it gives the possibility to control the valid elements and attributes and force attribute values or default them.

param.name: s
param.summary: Rule string to parse and add to the cleanup rules array.

method.name: isValid
method.summary: Returns true/false if the element name if valid or not against the cleanup rules.

param.name: n
param.summary: Node name to validate.

return.summary: True/false if the name is valid or not.

method.name: addChildRemoveRuleStr
method.summary: format: h1/h2/h3/h4/h5/h6[%inline_trans_no_a],table[thead|tbody|tfoot|tr|td],body[%btrans]=>p

method.name: parseRuleStr
method.summary: Parses a cleanup rule string, for example: a[!href|name|title=title|class=class1?class2?class3]. These rules are then used when serializing the DOM tree as a HTML string, it gives the possibility to control the valid elements and attributes and force attribute values or default them.

param.name: s
param.summary: Rule string to parse as a name/value rule array.

return.summary: Parsed name/value rule array.

method.name: serializeNodeAsXML
method.summary: Serializes the specified node as a HTML string. This uses the XML parser and serializer to generate a XHTML string.

param.name: n
param.summary: Node to serialize as a XHTML string.

return.summary: Serialized XHTML string based on specified node.

method.name: serializeNodeAsHTML
method.summary: Serializes the specified node as a XHTML string. This uses the TinyMCE serializer logic since it gives more control over the output than the build in browser XML serializer.

param.name: n
param.summary: Node to serialize as a XHTML string.

param.name: inn
param.summary: Optional inner HTML mode. Will only output child nodes and not the parent.

return.summary: Serialized XHTML string based on specified node.

method.name: formatHTML
method.summary: Applies source formatting/indentation on the specified HTML string.

param.name: h
param.summary: HTML string to apply formatting to.

return.summary: Formatted HTML string.

method.name: xmlEncode
method.summary: XML Encodes the specified string based on configured entity encoding. The entity encoding modes are raw, numeric and named. Where raw is the fastest and named is default.

param.name: s
param.summary: String to convert to XML.

return.summary: Encoded XML string based on configured entity encoding.

method.name: split
method.summary: Splits the specified string and removed empty chunks.

param.name: re
param.summary: RegEx to split string by.

param.name: s
param.summary: String value to split.

return.summary: Array with parts from specified string.

constructor.name: TinyMCE_Control
constructor.summary: This is the TinyMCE editor control instance class. A instance of this class will is made for each converted text area.

param.name: settings
param.summary: Name/Value array of instance specific configuration settings.

field.name: selection
field.summary: Contains methods for handling the current instance selection.

field.name: settings
field.summary: Name/Value array containing all instance settings.

field.name: cleanup
field.summary: Cleanup engine reference, handles all XHTML serialization and cleanup.

method.name: getData
method.summary: Get custom data storage object by name. The name should be for example the theme name or plugin name. The custom data storage can be used to store plugin/theme specific information on a editor instance. A empty object will be created automaticly the first time called.

param.name: na
param.summary: Name of data storate to retrive.

return.summary: Data storage object

method.name: hasPlugin
method.summary: Returns true/false if the instance has the current plugin available.

param.name: n
param.summary: Plugin name to check for.

return.summary: true/false if the instance has the current plugin available.

method.name: addPlugin
method.summary: Adds a plugin to the editor instance. This will also add it globaly.

param.name: n
param.summary: Plugin name to check for.

param.name: n
param.summary: TinyMCE plugin instance.

method.name: repaint
method.summary: Repaints the editarea in Gecko browsers. This method removes ghost resize handlers and other trailing graphics.

method.name: switchSettings
method.summary: Switches the global TinyMCE settings to the current instance settings. This method is used to handle multiple configurations.

method.name: select
method.summary: Selects this instance as the currently selected instance. This will also dispatch a selectInstance call to all themes, plugins and other listeners.

method.name: getBody
method.summary: Returns the body element of a editor instance.

return.summary: Body element of a editor instance.

method.name: getDoc
method.summary: Returns the DOM document of a editor instance.

return.summary: DOM document of a editor instance.

method.name: getWin
method.summary: Returns the window of a editor instance.

return.summary: Window of a editor instance.

method.name: getContainerWin
method.summary: Returns the container window of a editor instance. The container window is the window where the current instance lives in.

return.summary: container window of a editor instance.

method.name: getViewPort
method.summary: Returns the viewport of the editor instance.

return.summary: Viewport object with fields top, left, width and height.

method.name: getParentNode
method.summary: Returns a node by the specified selector function. This function will loop through all parent nodes and call the specified function for each node. If the function then returns true it will stop the execution and return that node. This function will not go below the instance body element.

param.name: n
param.summary: HTML node to search parents on.

param.name: f
param.summary: Selection function to execute on each node.

return.summary: DOMNode or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: getParentElement
method.summary: Returns the parent element of the specified node based on the search criteria. This method will not go below the point of the instance body.

param.name: node
param.summary: Node to get parent element of.

param.name: na
param.summary: Comma separated list of element names to get.

param.name: f
param.summary: Optional function to call for each node, if it returns true the node is valid.

return.summary: HTMLElement or null based on search criteras.

method.name: getParentBlockElement
method.summary: Returns the first block element parent of the specified node. This method will not go below the point of the instance body.

param.name: n
param.summary: Node get parent block element for.

return.summary: First block element parent of the specified node or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: resizeToContent
method.summary: Auto resizes the current editor instance to match the inner document size.

method.name: addShortcut
method.summary:
Adds a keyboard shortcut to a specific command. These shortcuts can for example be added at the initInstance callback of a plugin. The shortcut description can be a language variable name or a string describing the function. If you don't specify a command, the shortcut will simply be a blocker shortcut. This enables you to remove built in shortcuts or remove theme specific shortcuts from a plugin.
Example shortcut inst.addShortcut('ctrl,alt', 'k', 'mceSomeCommand', false, 'somevalue'); Example blocker inst.addShortcut('ctrl,alt', 'k');

param.name: m
param.summary: List of shortcut modifiers keys, for example "ctrl,alt".

param.name: k
param.summary: Shortcut key char for example "s" or a keycode value "13".

param.name: d
param.summary: Optional Shortcut description, this will be presented in the about dialog.

param.name: cmd
param.summary: Optional Command name to execute, for example mceLink or Bold.

param.name: ui
param.summary: Optional True/false state if a UI (dialog) should be presented or not.

param.name: va
param.summary: Optional command value, this can be anything.

return.summary: true/false if the shortcut was added or not

method.name: handleShortcut
method.summary: Executes shortcuts based on the event information.

param.name: e
param.summary: Keyboard event to handle.

return.summary: true/false if the shortcut was found and executed or not.

method.name: autoResetDesignMode
method.summary: Auto resets the design mode of the document if it gets lost. This is a Gecko specific function since it's a workaround for a bug where Gecko browsers loose the designMode state if the editor is hidden and shown in a tab or div.

method.name: isHidden
method.summary: Returns if the instance is hidden or not. This is a Gecko specific function other browsers will always return false. This function is used to workaround the lost designMode bug in Gecko browsers.

return.summary: Returns if the instance is hidden or not.

method.name: isDirty
method.summary: Returns true/false if the editor instance is dirty or not. In other words if it has been modified or not.

return.summary: Editor instance dirty state.

method.name: _fixRootBlocks
method.summary: Generates root level block elements such a P for inline elements and text nodes.

method.name: _fixTrailingNbsp
method.summary: Removes any traling   to the current block element.

method.name: execCommand
method.summary: Executes a command on the current instance. These commands can be TinyMCE internal commands prefixed with "mce" or they can be build in browser commands such as "Bold". A compleate list of browser commands is available on MSDN or Mozilla.org. This function will dispatch the execCommand function on each plugin, theme or the execcommand_callback option if none of these return true it will handle the command as a internal browser command.

param.name: command
param.summary: Command name to execute, for example mceLink or Bold.

param.name: user_interface
param.summary: True/false state if a UI (dialog) should be presented or not.

param.name: value
param.summary: Optional command value, this can be anything.

method.name: queryCommandValue
method.summary: Returns a command specific value, for example the current font size.

param.name: c
param.summary: Command to query value from.

return.summary: Command specific value, for example the current font size.

method.name: queryCommandState
method.summary: Returns a command specific state, for example if bold is enabled or not.

param.name: c
param.summary: Command to query state from.

return.summary: Command specific state, for example if bold is enabled or not.

method.name: _addBogusBR
method.summary: Adds a bogus BR to make the cursor visible in Gecko.

method.name: setBaseHREF
method.summary: Sets the base href url of the current document instance. This method is used to temporarly remove the base url during copy/paste and drag/drop operations of relative links from external sites into TinyMCE. MSIE has a bug and converts relative links from external sites to absolute links incorrectly.

param.name: u
param.summary: URL to set as base URL or null to remove it.

method.name: getHTML
method.summary: Returns the cleaned HTML of the editor control instance.

param.name: r
param.summary: Optional raw parameter, if set to true. Cleanup will be skipped.

return.summary: Cleaned HTML content string.

method.name: setHTML
method.summary: Sets the HTML contents of the instance.

param.name: h
param.summary: HTML content string to replace body with.

method.name: getFocusElement
method.summary: Returns the currently selected element. This is was added for compatiblity and is deprecated. Please use inst.selection.getFocusElement instead.

return.summary: Currently selected element.

method.name: getSel
method.summary: Returns the browsers selection instance. This is was added for compatiblity and is deprecated. Please use inst.selection.getSel instead.

return.summary: Browser selection instance.

method.name: getRng
method.summary: Returns the browsers selections first range instance. This is was added for compatiblity and is deprecated. Please use inst.selection.getRng instead.

return.summary: Browsers selections first range instance.

method.name: triggerSave
method.summary: Moves the contents from the TinyMCE editor control instance to the hidden textarea that got replaced with TinyMCE. This is executed automaticly on for example form submit unless you configure otherwice.

param.name: skip_cleanup
param.summary: Optional Skip cleanup, simply move the contents as fast as possible.

param.name: skip_callback
param.summary: Optional Skip callback, don't call the save_callback function.

constructor.name: TinyMCE_Layer
constructor.summary: Constructor for the TinyMCE Layer. This class enables you to construct floating layers that is visible on top of select input fields, flashes and iframes.

param.name: id
param.summary: Unique ID name for the layer.

param.name: bm
param.summary: Block mode, defaults to true.

method.name: moveRelativeTo
method.summary: Moves the layer relative to the specified HTML element.

param.name: re
param.summary: Element to move the layer relative to.

param.name: p
param.summary: Position of the layer tl = top left, tr = top right, bl = bottom left, br = bottom right.

method.name: moveBy
method.summary: Moves the layer relative in pixels.

param.name: x
param.summary: Horizontal relative position in pixels.

param.name: y
param.summary: Vertical relative position in pixels.

method.name: moveTo
method.summary: Moves the layer absolute in pixels.

param.name: x
param.summary: Horizontal absolute position in pixels.

param.name: y
param.summary: Vertical absolute position in pixels.

method.name: resizeBy
method.summary: Resizes the layer by the specified relative width and height.

param.name: w
param.summary: Relative width value.

param.name: h
param.summary: Relative height value.

method.name: resizeTo
method.summary: Resizes the layer to the specified width and height.

param.name: w
param.summary: Width value.

param.name: h
param.summary: Height value.

method.name: show
method.summary: Shows the layer.

method.name: hide
method.summary: Hides the layer.

method.name: isVisible
method.summary: Returns true/false if the layer is visible or not.

return.summary: true/false if it's visible or not.

method.name: getElement
method.summary: Returns the DOM element that the layer is binded to.

return.summary: DOM HTML element.

method.name: setBlockMode
method.summary: Sets the block mode. If you set this property to true a control box blocker iframe will be added to the document since MSIE has a issue where select boxes are visible through layers.

param.name: s
param.summary: Block mode state, true is the default value.

method.name: updateBlocker
method.summary: Updates the select/iframe/flash blocker this will also block the caret in Firefox.

method.name: getBlocker
method.summary: Returns the blocker DOM element, this is a invisible iframe.

return.summary: DOM HTML element.

method.name: getAbsPosition
method.summary: Returns the absolute x, y cordinate of the specified node.

param.name: n
param.summary: DOM node to retrive x, y of.

return.summary: Object containing absLeft and absTop properties.

method.name: create
method.summary: Creates a element for the layer based on the id and specified name.

param.name: n
param.summary: Element tag name, like div.

param.name: c
param.summary: Optional class name to set as class attribute value.

param.name: p
param.summary: Optional parent element reference, defaults to body.

param.name: h
param.summary: Optional HTML code to insert into element.

return.summary: HTML DOM element that got created.

method.name: exists
method.summary: Returns true/false if a element exists for the layer.

return.summary: true/false if a element exists for the layer.

method.name: parseInt
method.summary: Parses a int value this method will return 0 if the string is empty.

param.name: s
param.summary: String to parse value of.

return.summary: Parsed number.

method.name: remove
method.summary: Removes the element for the layer from DOM and also the blocker iframe.

constructor.name: TinyMCE_Menu
constructor.summary: Constructor for the menu layer class.

method.name: init
method.summary: Initializes the Menu with settings. This will also create the menu as a DIV element if it doesn't exists in the DOM.

param.name: s
param.summary: Name/Value array with settings.

method.name: clear
method.summary: Clears the menu.

method.name: addTitle
method.summary: Adds a menu title, this is a static item that can't be clicked.

param.name: t
param.summary: Text to add to title.

method.name: addDisabled
method.summary: Adds a disabled menu item, this is a static item that can't be clicked.

param.name: t
param.summary: Text to add to title.

method.name: addSeparator
method.summary: Adds a menu separator line.

method.name: addItem
method.summary: Adds a menu item.

param.name: t
param.summary: Menu item text.

param.name: js
param.summary: JS string to evaluate on click.

method.name: add
method.summary: Adds a menu item object.

param.name: mi
param.summary: Menu item object to add.

method.name: update
method.summary: Update the menu with new HTML contents.

method.name: show
method.summary: Displays the menu. This function will automaticly hide any previously visible menus.

constructor.name: TinyMCE_Popup
constructor.summary: Constructor for the popup class. This class contains base logic for popup/dialogs and sets up object references to the TinyMCE core.

method.name: findWin
method.summary: Searches for a window with a TinyMCE instance by looping through parent windows and openers.

param.name: w
param.summary: DOM window to start search by.

return.summary: Window with TinyMCE instance in it or null.

method.name: init
method.summary: Initializes the TinyMCE Popup class. This will setup the TinyMCE core references and other popup/dialog related functions.

method.name: onLoad
method.summary: Gets executed when the window has finished loading it's contents. This function will then replace language variables with their real values.

method.name: executeOnLoad
method.summary: Executes the specified string onload. This is a workaround for Opera since it doesn't execute the events in the same order than MSIE and Firefox.

param.name: str
param.summary: String to evaluate on load.

method.name: resizeToInnerSize
method.summary: Resizes the current window to it's inner body size. This function was needed since MSIE makes the visible dialog area diffrent depending on what Theme/Skin you use.

method.name: resizeToContent
method.summary: Resizes the current window to the dimensions of the body.

method.name: getWindowArg
method.summary: Returns a window argument, window arguments can be passed from a plugin to a window by using the tinyMCE.openWindow function.

param.name: name
param.summary: Argument name to retrive.

param.name: default_value
param.summary: Optional default value to assign if the argument wasn't set.

return.summary: Argument value object.

method.name: restoreSelection
method.summary: Restores the selection back to the one stored after executing a command. This function was needed in MSIE when using inlinepopups, the selection would otherwice get lost if the user focused another field.

method.name: execCommand
method.summary: Executes the specific command on the parent instance that opened the window. This method will also take care of the storage and restorage of the current selection in MSIE when using inlinepopups. So we suggest using this method instead of tinyMCE.execCommand when using popup windows.

param.name: command
param.summary: Command name to execute, for example mceLink or Bold.

param.name: user_interface
param.summary: True/false state if a UI (dialog) should be presented or not.

param.name: value
param.summary: Optional command value, this can be anything.

method.name: close
method.summary: Closes the current window. This should be used instead of window.close. Since this will also handle inlinepopups closing.

method.name: pickColor
method.summary: Executes a color picker on the specified element id. When the user then selects a color it will be set as the value of the specified element.

param.name: e
param.summary: DOM event object.

param.name: element_id
param.summary: Element id to be filled with the color value from the picker.

method.name: openBrowser
method.summary: Opens a filebrowser/imagebrowser this will set the output value from the browser as a value on the specified element.

param.name: element_id
param.summary: Id of the element to set value in.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type of browser to open image/file/flash.

param.name: option
param.summary: Option name to get the file_broswer_callback function name from.

method.name: importClass
method.summary: Imports the specified class into the current popup. This will setup a local class definition by importing from the parent window.

param.name: c
param.summary: Class name to import to current page.

constructor.name: TinyMCE_Selection
constructor.summary: Constructs a Selection instance and binds it to the specificed TinyMCE editor control.

param.name: inst
param.summary: TinyMCE editor control instance.

method.name: getSelectedHTML
method.summary: Returns the selected HTML code.

return.summary: Selected HTML contents.

method.name: getSelectedText
method.summary: Returns the selected text.

return.summary: Selected text contents.

method.name: getBookmark
method.summary: Returns a selection bookmark that can be restored later with moveToBookmark. This acts much like the one MSIE has built in but this one is persistent if between DOM tree rewritings. The simple mode enables a quicker and non persistent bookmark.

param.name: simple
param.summary: If this is set to true, the selection bookmark will not me dom persistent.

return.summary: Selection bookmark that can be restored later with moveToBookmark.

method.name: moveToBookmark
method.summary: Restores the selection to the specified bookmark.

param.name: bookmark
param.summary: Bookmark to restore selection from.

return.summary: true/false if it was successful or not.

method.name: selectNode
method.summary: Selects the specified node.

param.name: node
param.summary: Node object to move selection to.

param.name: collapse
param.summary: True/false if it will be collasped.

param.name: select_text_node
param.summary: True/false if the text contents should be selected or not.

param.name: to_start
param.summary: True/false if the collapse should be to start or end of range.

method.name: scrollToNode
method.summary: Scrolls to the specified node location.

param.name: node
param.summary: Node to scroll to.

method.name: getAbsPosition
method.summary: Returns a global absolute position calculating both the container iframe location and the position within.

method.name: getSel
method.summary: Returns the browsers selection instance.

return.summary: Browser selection instance.

method.name: getRng
method.summary: Returns the browsers selections first range instance.

return.summary: Browsers selections first range instance.

method.name: isCollapsed
method.summary: Returns true/false if the current selection is collapsed or not.

return.summary: true/false if the current selection is collapsed or not.

method.name: collapse
method.summary: Collapses the current selection to start or end.

param.name: b
param.summary: true - to start, false - to end.

method.name: getFocusElement
method.summary: Returns the currently selected/focused element.

return.summary: Currently selected element.

constructor.name: TinyMCE_UndoRedo
constructor.summary: Constructs a undo redo instance, this instance handles the custom undo/redo handeling in TinyMCE.

param.name: inst
param.summary: TinyMCE editor control instance.

method.name: add
method.summary: Adds a new undo level, this will take a snapshot of the current instance HTML or use the specified level.

param.name: l
param.summary: Optional undo/redo level to add.

return.summary: true/false on success or failure.

method.name: undo
method.summary: Performes a undo action, this will restore the HTML contents of the editor to a former state.

method.name: redo
method.summary: Performes a undo action, this will restore the HTML contents of the editor to a former undoed state.
